newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq sets record again as small caps take lead.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq sets record again as small caps take lead.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks finished at a record high for the sixth time in row on Thursday as gains in small-capitalization stocks offset a tepid performance by technology issues.

The Nasdaq composite index gained 4.30 points, or 0.29 percent, to close at an all-time high of 1490.93, the 23rd record close of the year. Advancing issues outnumbered losers 2,305 to 2,000 on total volume of 644 million shares.

"A lot of the smaller caps came up. It may be a broadening out of the rally. People are looking for new places to put their money now that some the Dow industrials have gotten so rosy," Nelson Gold, senior vice president of the over-the-counter trading at Interstate-Johnson Lane Corp.
The Russell 2000 index, a key barometer of small-capitalization issues, added 1.75 points, or 0.44 percent, to 399.15, a record.
Despite the gains among smaller issues, technology stocks slipped, with Intel Corp, Dell Computer Corp and Microsoft Corp each posting losses.
PairGain Technologies Inc, the most active Nasdaq issue, dropped 1-11/16 to 16-9/16 after its second-quarter results came in below expectations.
